description: This research explores new methods for integrating IoT devices into smart city infrastructures, focusing on enhanced security, efficient data processing, and real-time decision-making for urban improvement.
Investigating the application of quantum computing in solving complex engineering problems, with a focus on efficiency and speed enhancements over classical computation methods.
A study on renewable energy sources for sustainable engineering practices, examining solar, wind, and biofuel technologies to reduce environmental impact in urban areas.
Developing robotics solutions that improve precision and efficiency in manufacturing processes, using AI-based automation to minimize human error and production costs.
Examining edge computing's role in processing data near the source, reducing latency for IoT applications in fields such as healthcare, transportation, and industrial automation.
Researching security protocols to protect smart grid infrastructures from cyber threats, focusing on data privacy and resilience against potential attacks on critical systems.
